Back to development: 4.1.1
Preparing release 4.1.0

Keep track if span is finished and do not double-report (#253)

* add guard for if span.finished

Signed-off-by: Abhilash Gnan <abhilashgnan@gmail.com>

* do not consider finishing span if not sampled

Signed-off-by: Abhilash Gnan <abhilashgnan@gmail.com>

* add span finish test

Signed-off-by: Abhilash Gnan <abhilashgnan@gmail.com>

* fix spacing

Signed-off-by: Abhilash Gnan <abhilashgnan@gmail.com>

* fix spacing

Signed-off-by: Abhilash Gnan <abhilashgnan@gmail.com>

* fix ci

Signed-off-by: Abhilash Gnan <abhilashgnan@gmail.com>

* add finished to slots

Signed-off-by: Abhilash Gnan <abhilashgnan@gmail.com>

Add stack traceback to error logs (#250)

* Add stack traceback to error logs

Previously, error logs only come with a tag of the form
"<traceback object at location>". Now they also report the actual
stack trace.

Resolves: #163

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Change traceback to be reported in stack

Previously, the traceback message was reported in error.object rather
than stack. The traceback message is now reported in the stack tag
of a error log, and it comes after the traceback object location.

In addition, two tests have been added to validate this behavior.

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Remove traceback location in report

The message 'traceback object at location' has been removed, so that
only the informative message about the stack trace is included in the
'stack' tag.

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Fix linting errors

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Use input traceback object instead of global state

Instead of reporting the stack trace of the globally stored traceback
object using traceback.format_exc, now report the stack trace of the
input traceback object `value`.

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Automatically catch exception using span in tests

Instead of manually logging an exception, use the context manager
properties of the span to automatically catch and log exceptions
when testing for traceback reporting behavior.

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Add max_traceback_length as parameter

Tracebacks used to be truncated at the same point as any other
string tag. As tracebacks tend to be long, this often resulted in
traceback messages being cut off halfway. Now they have their own
length limit, which defaults to four times longer than the limit for
normal string tags and can be set when a tracer is created.

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Remove traceback length from 'process' methods

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Remove pytest cache

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Nit, add back commas

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Fix traceback test

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Add traceback length to config, spans, etc

Signed-off-by: Qi Qi <piano.keys0@gmail.com>

* Add Tornado 5 supporting

* Return opentracing-instrumentation in tests dependencies

Signed-off-by: Vasilii Novikov <novikov.vz@gmail.com>

* Test different Tornado versions

Access opentracing.tracer using api functions (#249)

Signed-off-by: Abhilash Gnan <abhilashgnan@gmail.com>
Back to development: 4.0.1
Preparing release 4.0.0

Support OpenTracing API v2.0 (#206)

* Use opentracing 2.0

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* remove redundant assignment

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* use opentracing in any 2.x version

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* allow specifying scope manager in config

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* Apply suggestions from code review: formatting fixes

Co-Authored-By: mihau <mszymanski@vewd.com>
Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* remove unnecessary new line

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* override test_start_activ_span

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* fix linter issues

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* pass an instance of a scope manager instead of a class

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* add a TODO to remove api tests override

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* remove trailing whitespace

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* reference opentracing-python release in TODO message

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* use named arguments

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* don't use active span if parent is passed explicitly

Signed-off-by: Michał Szymański <mszymanski@vewd.com>

* Fix lint

Signed-off-by: Yuri Shkuro <ys@uber.com>

* Bump OT to 2.1 and remove test override

Signed-off-by: Yuri Shkuro <ys@uber.com>

Add support for references (#241)

* Add support for references

- Checks if all the given references are valid
- If the parent is not set then sets the first reference as parent of
  the span
- Allows to pass one Reference object or list of them

Signed-off-by: Bhavin Gandhi <bhavin7392@gmail.com>

* Add tests for the references support

Signed-off-by: Bhavin Gandhi <bhavin7392@gmail.com>

* Avoid allocation if references are None

Signed-off-by: Yuri Shkuro <ys@uber.com>

Add info on configuring Jaeger agent location. (#245)

This is in response to [this issue](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger-client-python/issues/47).

Signed-off-by: Carlos Nunez <carlosonunez@noreply.github.com>

Add 128bit trace_id support (#230)

* Add 128bit trace_id support

- Creates a new property in Config 'generate_128bit_trace_id' if set
  to True then 128bit trace_ids are generated
  - Adds support for environment variable JAEGER_TRACEID_128BIT. If
  the value is 'true' then 128bit trace_ids are generated
- Tracer takes variable generate_128bit_trace_id, if the value is True
  then max_trace_id_bits is set to constants._max_trace_id_bits
  - Adds new function _random_id(bitsize)
  - Deprecate random_id() in favor of _random_id(bitsize)
- Deprecate MAX_ID_BITS in favor of _max_trace_id_bits and _max_id_bits
- Set low and high bits of traceId correctly
  - Uses _id_to_high() and _id_to_low() to do that

Signed-off-by: Bhavin Gandhi <bhavin7392@gmail.com>

* Add tests for 128bit trace_id support

Signed-off-by: Bhavin Gandhi <bhavin7392@gmail.com>

* Update ProbabilisticSampler to trim the trace_id to 64bits

Signed-off-by: Bhavin Gandhi <bhavin7392@gmail.com>

* Update test_round_trip to test with 128bit trace_id

- Uses itertools.product to create a list with all possible
  combinations for tracer i.e. tracer with 64bit trace_id and tracer
  with 128bit trace_id

Signed-off-by: Bhavin Gandhi <bhavin7392@gmail.com>

* Add test_inject_with_128bit_trace_id to test_codecs.py

- This tests the behavior of inject for different codes when it
  receives 64bit/128bit trace_id on wire when tracer is configured to
  genereate 64/128bit trace_ids
- Also tests the behavior of inject when tracer is configured to
  generate 64/128bit trace_ids

Signed-off-by: Bhavin Gandhi <bhavin7392@gmail.com>

Enable linting of tests (#227)

Changes for including flake8 in tests folder

Signed-off-by: pravar <pravarag@gmail.com>

Enable windows support by isolating ioctl calls (#233)

* Enable windows support by isolating ioctl calls

Signed-off-by: Etienne Carriere <etienne.a.carriere@socgen.com>

* Remove the case when its returns anything but an IP

Signed-off-by: Etienne Carriere <etienne.a.carriere@socgen.com>

* Add basic tests for get_local_ip_by_socket

Signed-off-by: Etienne Carriere <etienne.a.carriere@socgen.com>
